metadata.feature_description: View and manage activity stream specific to groups

steps.action: Navigate to Groups > Test Activity Group > Activity tab
steps.expected: Group activity stream page loads with group-specific posts
steps.actual: Group activity stream loaded successfully showing group name 'Test Activity Group' and group-specific posts

steps.expected: Multiple group-specific posts visible with timestamps and action links
steps.actual: Multiple posts visible including test posts, wiki articles with Like, Comment, Remove, Pin options

steps.action: Click on 'Tell the world something...' input area and type a test message
steps.actual: Message 'Test post from Claude automated testing - January 9, 2026' entered in the content-editable input area

steps.action: Click Share button to post the message
steps.expected: Post appears in the activity stream with timestamp
steps.actual: Post appeared at the top of the activity stream with 'moments ago' timestamp and action links (Like, Comment, Unsubscribe, Remove, Pin)

steps.expected: User is logged out and redirected to logged-out view
steps.actual: Successfully logged out, 'Register | Login' links appeared instead of user menu

steps.action: View group activity stream as anonymous user
steps.expected: Group posts should be hidden or restricted for non-members
steps.actual: Only 1 public wiki article post visible. All direct posts (6 posts) were hidden from non-members. 'Join Group' button appeared instead of posting area.

steps.action: View filter dropdown showing available filter options
steps.expected: Filter dropdown with multiple activity type options
steps.actual: Filter dropdown displayed with options: Posts, Links, Photos, Files, Forum Topics, Forum Replies, Blogs, Added to Wiki, and many more

steps.action: Select 'Added to Wiki' from filter dropdown
steps.expected: Activity stream filters to show only wiki-related activities
steps.actual: Successfully filtered - only 1 wiki article activity shown ('Anonymous authored wiki article Group Wiki Test Article'). All 5 other posts were correctly filtered out.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Moderate group posts as group admin

steps.action: Click Pin link on a test post
steps.expected: Post should be pinned and Pin link changes to Unpin
steps.actual: Post successfully pinned - link changed from 'Pin' to 'Unpin', blue pin icon appeared on the post, post moved to top of stream

steps.action: Click Remove link on a privacy test post
steps.expected: Confirmation dialog appears, post is removed after confirmation
steps.actual: Confirmation dialog 'Are you sure you want to delete this item?' appeared. After clicking 'Yes', the post 'Privacy Test: Group Members - Testing Group Members privacy option...' was successfully removed from the activity stream.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Test group activity with different group types

steps.action: Navigate to Groups directory to find groups of different types
steps.expected: Multiple groups with different types (public, private) available for testing
steps.actual: Only 1 group ('Test Activity Group') exists in the system. No other group types available for comparison testing.

issues: Only one group exists in the test environment, preventing testing of different group types (public vs private). Would require creating additional groups with different privacy settings to fully test this scenario.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Leave group and verify access removal

steps.action: Attempt to find Leave Group option
steps.expected: Leave Group button/link should be available for members
steps.actual: Current user (SuperUser Account) is the Group Owner. Group owners cannot leave their own group without first transferring ownership. No 'Leave Group' option available for owners.

issues: Cannot test 'Leave group and verify access removal' because the logged-in user is the Group Owner (shown as 'You' under Group Owner section). Group owners must transfer ownership before leaving. Would require a separate non-owner member account to test this scenario.

observations: The Activity Stream module successfully integrates with the Group Spaces module to provide group-specific activity feeds
Privacy settings work correctly - posts marked for 'Group Members' visibility are hidden from non-members
The filter functionality is comprehensive with 30+ activity types available for filtering
Moderation tools (Pin/Unpin, Remove) work as expected with confirmation dialogs for destructive actions
Code review of ActivityStreamServicesController.cs confirms server-side validation for group access permissions via RequireGroupAccessPermission and HasInvalidSecuritySet methods
The posting area uses a content-editable div rather than a standard input field
Anonymous/logged-out users can see the group page but cannot post and see only public content (like wiki articles)
Test environment limitation: Only one group exists, preventing comprehensive testing of different group types
Test environment limitation: Current user is the Group Owner, preventing testing of 'Leave Group' functionality
